meta.title: Scriptures | Vedas — Sanatana Dharma - Explore Sanatan Dharma
meta.description: Vedas — Rigveda, Yajurveda, Samaveda, Atharvaveda — Articles, translations and concise commentary on Vedas. Explore practices, history, and guiding...
meta.keywords: Vedas, Sanatana Dharma, Hinduism, Vedic philosophy, Dharma and spirituality, Hindu scriptures, Bhagavad Gita teachings, Upanishads, Vedas and Puranas, Hindu rituals and traditions, Yoga and meditation, Hindu festivals, Spiritual wisdom, Hindu culture and heritage, Indian philosophy, Hindu gods and goddesses, Karma and rebirth, What is Sanatana Dharma, Principles of Sanatana Dharma, Importance of Vedas in Hinduism, Hindu spiritual practices for daily life, Meaning of Dharma in Hinduism, Sanatana Dharma vs modern life, How to follow Sanatana Dharma?, Sanatana Dharma in India, Dharma, Mantra, Stotra, Stotras, Scripture, Scriptures, Commentary, Devotion, Practices, Ritual, Worship, Temple

vedas_scriptures.title: Ancient Hindu scriptures considered divine revelations, forming the foundation of Sanatan Dharma.
vedas_scriptures.intro: The Vedas (from the Sanskrit root 'vid' — to know) are the oldest stratum of South Asian sacred literature. Composed in Vedic Sanskrit and preserved through conservative oral transmission, they shaped ritual practice, social ideals, and early Indian thought.

origin.transmission: Orally preserved for centuries before being written in Vedic Sanskrit.

fourvedas.name: Rigveda
fourvedas.content: Hymns praising deities like Agni, Indra, Varuna

fourvedas.name: Yajurveda
fourvedas.content: Prose mantras for sacrifices and rituals

fourvedas.name: Atharvaveda
fourvedas.content: Hymns, spells, and incantations for daily life

upanishads.definition: Philosophical texts forming the concluding part of the Vedas, focusing on spiritual knowledge.

major_upanishads.name: Isha
major_upanishads.summary: Teaches renunciation and unity of Brahman in all beings.

major_upanishads.name: Kena
major_upanishads.summary: Explores the source of perception and ultimate reality.

major_upanishads.name: Katha
major_upanishads.summary: Dialogue between Nachiketa and Yama on immortality.

major_upanishads.name: Mundaka
major_upanishads.summary: Higher and lower knowledge; Brahman as supreme reality.

major_upanishads.name: Mandukya
major_upanishads.summary: Analysis of Om and states of consciousness.

major_upanishads.name: Taittiriya
major_upanishads.summary: Layers of human existence; bliss of Brahman.

major_upanishads.name: Chandogya
major_upanishads.summary: Meditation, ethics, and the concept of 'Tat Tvam Asi'.

timeline.description: Composition of Rigveda hymns; oral tradition begins.
Development of Samaveda and Yajurveda; ritualistic focus.
Atharvaveda composed; Brahmanas and Aranyakas written.
Philosophical shift; Upanishads compiled emphasizing spiritual knowledge.
Vedas and Upanishads documented in written form.

timeline.date: Traditional: Treta Yuga | Astronomical Estimate: ~5114 BCE
timeline.description: Seventh avatar of Vishnu born in Ayodhya; celebrated as Rama Navami.

timeline.date: Traditional: Dvapara Yuga | Astronomical Estimate: ~3228 BCE
timeline.description: Eighth avatar of Vishnu born in Mathura; celebrated as Janmashtami.
Traditional Christian belief places Jesus' birth before the death of King Herod.
Shiva is eternal, beyond birth and death; manifests as cosmic consciousness.

all_108_upanishads.description: Complete list of 108 Upanishads as per Muktika tradition.
